bug.author: tidbeck
bug.description:
Hardware: MacBook Pro (Retina, Mid 2012) 2,3 GHz, 8GB, Geforce GT 650M Software version: macOS Catalina 10.15.1 Python 3.7.4 turicreate 5.8 Steps to reproduce <denchmark-code>import turicreate as tc data = tc.SFrame('cats.sframe') train_data, test_data = data.random_split(0.8) model = tc.object_detector.create(train_data) </denchmark-code>
Result <denchmark-code>â–¶ python3 Train.py +--------------------------+-------------------------------+ | image | annotations | +--------------------------+-------------------------------+ | Height: 1500 Width: 843 | [{'label': 'cat', 'coordin... | | Height: 1500 Width: 843 | [{'label': 'cat', 'coordin... | | Height: 1500 Width: 1125 | [{'label': 'cat', 'coordin... | | Height: 1500 Width: 1125 | [{'label': 'cat', 'coordin... | | Height: 1500 Width: 1125 | [{'label': 'cat', 'coordin... | | Height: 1500 Width: 1125 | [{'label': 'cat', 'coordin... | | Height: 1500 Width: 1125 | [{'label': 'cat', 'coordin... | | Height: 1500 Width: 1125 | [{'label': 'cat', 'coordin... | | Height: 1500 Width: 1125 | [{'label': 'cat', 'coordin... | | Height: 1500 Width: 1125 | [{'label': 'cat', 'coordin... | +--------------------------+-------------------------------+ [49 rows x 2 columns] Note: Only the head of the SFrame is printed. You can use print_rows(num_rows=m, num_columns=n) to print more rows and columns. Using 'image' as feature column Using 'annotations' as annotations column Setting 'batch_size' to 16 Using GPU to create model (NVIDIA GeForce GT 650M) Setting 'max_iterations' to 2000 +--------------+--------------+--------------+ | Iteration | Loss | Elapsed Time | +--------------+--------------+--------------+ | 1 | 4.985 | 19.0 | ... ... ... | 936 | 1.256 | 6111.2 | Error: command buffer exited with error status. The Metal Performance Shaders operations encoded on it may not have completed. Error: (null) Internal Error (IOAF code 1) <NVMTLCommandBuffer: 0x7fa731dc2e50> label = <none> device = <NVMTLDevice: 0x1196da000> name = NVIDIA GeForce GT 650M commandQueue = <NVMTLCommandQueue: 0x7fa72bb9c7b0> label = <none> device = <NVMTLDevice: 0x1196da000> name = NVIDIA GeForce GT 650M retainedReferences = 1 Error: command buffer exited with error status. The Metal Performance Shaders operations encoded on it may not have completed. Error: (null) Invalid Resource (IOAF code 9) <NVMTLCommandBuffer: 0x7fa72d934420> label = <none> device = <NVMTLDevice: 0x1196da000> name = NVIDIA GeForce GT 650M commandQueue = <NVMTLCommandQueue: 0x7fa72bb9c7b0> label = <none> device = <NVMTLDevice: 0x1196da000> name = NVIDIA GeForce GT 650M retainedReferences = 1 2019-11-10 22:00:36.033 Python[57579:1102974] Error Traceback (most recent call last): File "Train.py", line 11, in <module> model = tc.object_detector.create(train_data) File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/turicreate/toolkits/object_detector/object_detector.py", line 699, in create cur_loss = wait_for_batch() File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/turicreate/toolkits/object_detector/object_detector.py", line 680, in wait_for_batch batch_loss = pending_loss.asnumpy() # Waits for the batch to finish File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/turicreate/toolkits/_mps_utils.py", line 347, in asnumpy assert status_code == 0, "Error calling TCMPSReadFloatArray" AssertionError: Error calling TCMPSReadFloatArray ^CException ignored in: <module 'threading' from '/usr/local/Cellar/python/3.7.4_1/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/3.7/lib/python3.7/threading.py'> Traceback (most recent call last): File "/usr/local/Cellar/python/3.7.4_1/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/3.7/lib/python3.7/threading.py", line 1308, in _shutdown lock.acquire() </denchmark-code>

comments.comment: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/tidbeck>@tidbeck</denchmark-link> - Thanks for reporting this issue. Do you always get this error or is the issue intermittent?
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/TobyRoseman>@TobyRoseman</denchmark-link> I tried three or four times and got it every time but not on the same iteration.
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/tidbeck>@tidbeck</denchmark-link> - Are you still seeing this behavior with TuriCreate 6.1?
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/TobyRoseman>@TobyRoseman</denchmark-link> unfortunately the battery on that computer gave up so I'm not able to test it. Guess you can close this issue.
